abstract: Stocks closed down about 1.5 percent, a day after a sharp sell-off on worries over slowing economic growth and tighter borrowing conditions.
snippet: Stocks closed down about 1.5 percent, a day after a sharp sell-off on worries over slowing economic growth and tighter borrowing conditions.
lead_paragraph: Stocks fell sharply on Wall Street today, a day after a sharp sell-off caused by worries about slowing economic growth and tighter borrowing conditions.

abstract: The Dow industrials lost more than 300 points Thursday, following similar drops in Europe.  The Nikkei 225 in Japan sank 2.4 percent in trading today.
snippet: The Dow industrials lost more than 300 points Thursday, following similar drops in Europe.  The Nikkei 225 in Japan sank 2.4 percent in trading today.
lead_paragraph: Stock prices tumbled on Wall Street and across much of the rest of the world yesterday. They were driven sharply lower by worries over slowing economic growth in the United States and worsening borrowing conditions that could make everything from huge corporate buyouts to buying a new home more difficult.

headline.main: Global Markets Tumble as Credit Worries Deepen
headline.print_headline: Global Stock Markets Tumble Amid Deepening Credit Fears

byline.original: By Floyd Norris and Vikas Bajaj

abstract: On a day that the Dow fell more than 300 points, the ethics scandal jolting Gov. Eliot Spitzer’s administration brought a rare smile to the lips of some of the Wall Street tycoons and business executives who so often found themselves on the losing side of the crusades that Mr. Spitzer waged as the state attorney general.
lead_paragraph: On a day that the Dow fell more than 300 points, the ethics scandal jolting Gov. Eliot Spitzer’s administration brought a rare smile to the lips of some of the Wall Street tycoons and business executives who so often found themselves on the losing side of the crusades that Mr. Spitzer waged as the state attorney general.

headline.main: On a Dreary Day, Spitzer’s Woes Bring Joy on Wall St.
